document_notes.text:
This update for u-boot fixes the following issues:

- Fix network boot on Raspberry Pi 3 B+ (bsc#1098649)
- Fix GOP pixel format (bsc#1098447)
- Fix SD writes on Raspberry Pi
- Enable a few more armv7 boards to boot with EFI
- Fix potentially miscompiled runtime service calls

Fix CVE-2019-14192 (bsc#1143777), CVE-2019-14193 (bsc#1143817), 
CVE-2019-14199 (bsc#1143824), CVE-2019-14197 (bsc#1143821), 
CVE-2019-14200 (bsc#1143825), CVE-2019-14201 (bsc#1143827),  
CVE-2019-14202 (bsc#1143828), CVE-2019-14203 (bsc#1143830), 
CVE-2019-14204 (bsc#1143831), CVE-2019-14194 (bsc#1143818), 
CVE-2019-14198 (bsc#1143823), CVE-2019-14195 (bsc#1143819), 
CVE-2019-14196 (bsc#1143820), CVE-2019-13103 (bsc#1143463), 
CVE-2020-8432 (bsc#1162198), CVE-2019-11059 (bsc#1134853), 
CVE-2019-11690 (bsc#1134157) and CVE-2020-10648 (bsc#1167209)
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: Das U-Boot 2016.11-rc1 through 2019.04 mishandles the ext4 64-bit extension, resulting in a buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15-ESPOS:u-boot-rpi3-2018.03-4.6.2
SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15-ESPOS:u-boot-tools-2018.03-4.6.1

SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 15:u-boot-tools-2018.03-4.6.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: gen_rand_uuid in lib/uuid.c in Das U-Boot v2014.04 through v2019.04 lacks an srand call, which allows attackers to determine UUID values in scenarios where CONFIG_RANDOM_UUID is enabled, and Das U-Boot is relied upon for UUID values of a GUID Partition Table of a boot device.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: A crafted self-referential DOS partition table will cause all Das U-Boot versions through 2019.07-rc4 to infinitely recurse, causing the stack to grow infinitely and eventually either crash or overwrite other data.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: An issue was discovered in Das U-Boot through 2019.07. There is an unbounded memcpy when parsing a UDP packet due to a net_process_received_packet integer underflow during an nc_input_packet call.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: An issue was discovered in Das U-Boot through 2019.07. There is an unbounded memcpy with an unvalidated length at nfs_readlink_reply, in the "if" block after calculating the new path length.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Das U-Boot through 2020.01 allows attackers to bypass verified boot restrictions and subsequently boot arbitrary images by providing a crafted FIT image to a system configured to boot the default configuration.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15-ESPOS:u-boot-rpi3-2018.03-4.6.2

SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 15:u-boot-tools-2018.03-4.6.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: In Das U-Boot through 2020.01, a double free has been found in the cmd/gpt.c do_rename_gpt_parts() function. Double freeing may result in a write-what-where condition, allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code. NOTE: this vulnerablity was introduced when attempting to fix a memory leak identified by static analysis.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
